channel.title: briefUpdatesHealthOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesHealthOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: To 'graduate' from poverty, they can borrow to build a business. So why aren't they?
item.description: It's called the "graduation" approach — both financial and moral support to help people move from extreme poverty to self-sufficiency. But in this inn...

item.title: Fewer characters on TV had abortions this year — and more stories reinforced shame
item.description: Researchers at the University of California San Francisco track how abortion comes up on television. They say the trends from 2025 are concerning.

item.title: Journalists Talk Increasing Insurance Costs, From Marketplace Plans to Employer Coverage
item.description: KFF Health News journalists made the rounds on national and local media recently to discuss topical stories. Here’s a collection of their appearances.

item.title: Why one trauma doctor sees self-driving cars as a 'public health breakthrough'
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks to Dr. Jonathan Slotkin about the new data released by Waymo about accidents and their self-driving cars.
